msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Numbers 7
ab.l:
And it was on the day that Moses had finished setting up
the tabernacle, and had anointed it and sanctified it
and all its equipment and the altar and all
its vessels. And he anointed them and sanctified them.

And the princes of Israel, the superiors
of the house of their fathers who are the princes of the tribes — they
were those standing over those numbered — brought forward,

And
they brought their offering before the Lord:
six covered wagons, and twelve oxen, a wagon for two of the princes,
and for each one an ox. And they brought them closer before the
tabernacle.
And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

‘Take it from them, and they shall be for serving the service
of the tent of meeting. And you shall give them to the Levites, to every man
according to his service.’

And Moses took the wagons and
the oxen and gave them to the Levites.

He gave two wagons and four oxen to the sons
of Gershon, according to their service.

And
he gave four wagons and eight oxen to the sons
of Merari, according to their service, under the hand of Ithamar,
son of Aaron, the priest.

And he did not give to the sons
of Kohath, because the service of the Holy is on them:
they carry on shoulders.

And the princes brought forward
the dedication of the altar in the day that it was anointed, and
the princes offered their offering before the
altar.

And the Lord said to Moses, ‘Each
prince on a day, each prince on a day, they shall bring forward their offering
for the dedication of the altar.’

And
the one who brought forward his offering the first day was Nahshon,
son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah.

And his offering:
one silver bowl, its weight one hundred and thirty mithqals, one
silver cup, its weight seventy mithqals by the mithqals of the Holy,
both of them were full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,
One gold spoon, ten |mithqals|, full of incense,

One calf, the young
of cattle, one ram, one one-year-old lamb for a burnt offering,
One kid of the goats for a sin offering,

And for a
sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, five one-year-old lambs.
This is the offering of Nahshon, son of Amminadab.

On the second day, Nethanel, son of Zuar,
prince of Issachar, brought forward.

He brought forward his offering:
one silver bowl, its weight a hundred and thirty mithqals,
one silver cup, its weight seventy mithqals by the mithqal
of the Holy, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil
for a grain offering,
One gold spoon, full of incense,

One calf, the young of cattle, one ram, one one-year-old lamb
for a burnt offering,
One kid of the goats for a sin offering,

And for a sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen,
five rams, five male goats, five one-year-old lambs. This is the offering of Nethanel,
son of Zuar.

On the third day
the prince of the sons of Zebulun, Eliab, son of Helon, brought forward.

His offering: one silver bowl, its weight a hundred and thirty mithqals,
one silver cup, its weight seventy mithqals by the mithqal of the Holy,
both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,
One gold spoon, ten |mithqals|, full of incense,

One calf,
a young of cattle, one ram, one one-year-old lamb for a burnt offering,
One kid of the goats for a sin offering,

And for a sacrifice of peace offerings:
two oxen, five rams, five male goats, five one-year-old lambs.
This is the offering of Eliab the son of Helon.

On the
fourth day, the prince of the sons of Reuben, Elizur, son
of Shedeur, brought forward.

His offering: one silver bowl,
its weight a hundred and thirty mithqals, one silver cup, its weight seventy
mithqals by the mithqal of the Holy, both of them full of fine flour
mixed with oil for a grain offering,

One gold spoon, ten |mithqals|
full of incense,

One calf, the young of cattle, one ram,
one one-year-old lamb for a burnt offering,

One kid of the goats
for a sin offering,

And for a sacrifice of peace offerings:
two oxen, five rams, five male goats, five one-year-old lambs.
This is the offering of Elizur, son of Shedeur.

On the fifth day, the prince of the sons of Simeon, Shelumiel,
son of Zurishaddai, brought forward.

His offering: one silver bowl, its weight a hundred and thirty
mithqals, one silver cup, its weight seventy mithqals
by the mithqal of the Holy, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil
for a grain offering,
One gold spoon, ten |mithqals|, full of incense,

One calf, the young of cattle, one ram, one one-year-old lamb
for a burnt offering,
One kid of the goats for a sin offering,

And for a sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams,
five male goats, five one-year-old lambs. This is the offering of Shelumiel, son
of Zurishaddai.

On the sixth day, the prince of the sons
of Gad, Eliasaph, son of Deuel, brought forward.

His offering:
one silver bowl, its weight a hundred and thirty mithqals, one
silver cup, its weight seventy mithqals by the mithqal of the Holy:
both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering.
One gold spoon, ten |mithqals|, full of incense,

One calf,
the young of cattle, one ram, one one-year-old lamb for a burnt offering,
One kid of the goats for a sin offering,

And for a sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats,
five one-year-old lambs. This is the offering of Eliasaph, son
of Deuel.

On the seventh day, the prince of the sons
of Ephraim, Elishama, son of Ammihud, brought forward.

His offering: one silver bowl, its weight a hundred and thirty mithqals,
one silver cup, its weight seventy mithqals by the mithqal
of the Holy, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,
One gold spoon, ten |mithqals|, full of incense,

One
calf, the young of cattle, one ram, one one-year-old lamb for a burnt offering,
One kid of the goats for a sin offering,

And for a sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats,
five one-year-old lambs. This is the offering of Elishama, son
of Ammihud.

On the eight day, the prince
of the sons of Manasseh, Gamaliel, son of Pedahzur, brought forward.

His offering: one silver bowl, its weight a hundred and thirty mithqals,
one silver cup, its weight seventy mithqals by the mithqal
of the Holy, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil
for a grain offering,
One gold spoon, ten |mithqals|, full of incense,

One calf, the young of cattle, one ram, one one-year-old lamb
for a burnt offering,
One kid of the goats for a sin offering,

And for a sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen,
five rams, five male goats, five one-year-old lambs. This is
the offering of Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.

On the ninth day, the prince of the sons of Benjamin, Abidan,
son of Gideoni, brought forward.

His offering: one silver bowl,
its weight a hundred and thirty mithqals, one silver cup,
its weight seventy mithqals by the mithqal, of the Holy, both of them full
of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

One gold spoon,
ten |mithqals|, full of incense,

One calf, the young of cattle,
one ram, one one-year-old lamb for a burnt offering,

One kid
of the goats for a sin offering,

And for a sacrifice of peace offerings:
two oxen, five rams, five male goats, five one-year-old lambs.
This is the offering of Abidan the son of Gideoni.

On the tenth day, the prince of the sons of Dan, Ahiezer,
son of Ammishaddai, brought forward.

His offering: one silver bowl,
its weight a hundred and thirty mithqals, one silver cup,
its weight seventy mithqals by the mithqal of the Holy, both of them full
of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

One gold spoon, ten
|mithqals|, full of incense,

One calf, the young of cattle, one
ram, one one-year-old lamb for a burnt offering,

One kid
of the goats for a sin offering,

And for a sacrifice of peace offerings:
two oxen, five rams, five male goats, five one-year-old lambs:
this is the offering of Ahiezer, son of Ammishaddai.

On the eleventh day, the prince of the sons of Asher,
Pagiel, son of Ocran, brought forward.

His offering:
one silver bowl, its weight a hundred and thirty mithqals, one silver cup,
its weight seventy mithqals by the mithqal of the Holy, both
of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

One
gold spoon, ten |mithqals|, full of incense,

One calf, the young
of cattle, one ram, one one-year-old lamb for a burnt offering,
One kid of the goats for a sin offering,

And for a sacrifice of peace offerings:
two oxen, five rams, five male goats, five one-year-old lambs.
This is the offering of Pagiel the son of Ocran.

On the day of the twelfth day, the prince of the sons of Naphtali,
Ahira, son of Enan, brought forward.

His offering: one silver
bowl, its weight a hundred and thirty mithqals, one silver cup,
its weight seventy mithqals by the mithqal of the Holy, both of them full
of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering.

One gold spoon,
ten |mithqals|, full of incense,

One calf, the young of cattle,
one ram, one one-year-old lamb for a burnt offering,

One kid
of the goats for a sin offering,

And for a sacrifice of peace offerings:
two oxen, five rams, five male goats, five one-year-old lambs.
This is the offering of Ahira the son of Enan.

One hundred and thirty mithqals of silver was in each bowl,
and seventy mithqals of silver was in each cup.
All the silver of the vessels: two thousand and four hundred mithqals
by the mithqal of the Holy.

The golden spoons twelve,
full of incense, ten mithqals of silver in each spoon by the mithqal
of the Holy. All the gold of the spoons was a hundred and twenty |mithqals|.

All the oxen for the burnt offering: twelve bullocks, the rams twelve,
the lambs, one-year old young, twelve, and their grain offering, and
the kids of the goats for sin offering twelve.

And all the oxen
for the sacrifice of the peace offerings: twenty-four calves, the rams sixty,
the male goats sixty, the lambs, one-year old young, sixty. This is
the dedication of the altar, after it was anointed.

And when Moses came into the tent of meeting to speak with him,
then he heard the voice of one speaking to him
from off the cover that was on the ark of law,
from between the two cherubim: and he spoke to him.
